Authors:
Chada Norphanphoun, Sinang Hongsanan, Eleni Gentekaki,
YI-JYUN CHEN, Chang-Hsin Kuo, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
A New species Of Phyllosticta assosiated with leaf spot of
Rhizophora Stylosa in Taiwan
Keywords:
1 new species, Microfungi, Morphology, Phylogenetic
analyses, Phyllostictaceae, Rhizophoeaceae, Synonym, Taxonomy
Abstract:
Phyllosticta causes leaf spots and fruit diseases on
various plants, and includes endophytes or saprobes, with worldwide
distribution. We introduce a new species, Phyllosticta rhizophorae from
Rhizophora stylosa in mangroves, Taiwan. Phylogenetic analysis based on
combined sequence data of ITS, LSU, EF1Î±, ACT and GPDH loci coupled with
morphological evidence support the new species. We synonymize P.
capitalensis (CPC 20508 and CPC20509) under the new species,
Phyllosticta conjac (MUCC0410) under P. capitalensis and six strains
(CBS 173.77, CBS 119720, CPC 17748, CPC 20252, CPC 20269, and CBS
123404) were kept as unknown species based on phylogenetic analyses and
polymorphism nucleotide. The phylogenetic relationships of Phyllosticta
species are reappraised with suggestions for future work.
